|commosccat=Krasnoyarsk |date=August 2010 }} 'Krasnoyarsk' () is a city and the
administrative center of Krasnoyarsk Krai, Russia, located on the Yenisei River.
It is the third largest city in Siberia after Novosibirsk and Omsk, with a
population of 973,826 (2010 Census). Krasnoyarsk is
an important junction of the Trans-Siberian Railway and one of Russia's largest
producers of aluminium.

The city is notable for its nature landscapes; author Anton Chekhov judged
Krasnoyarsk to be the most beautiful city in Siberia. Anton Chekhov, "The
Crooked Mirror" and Other Stories, Zebra Book, 1995. See page 200 for English
translation of his journey through Siberia.
